results.title: Lisinopril-Induced Acute Necrotizing Pancreatitis
results.text_hl: A 53-year-old Caucasian male with a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ presented with a one-day history of @DISEASE_Postoperative_Nausea_and_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D020250 @@@nausea, vomiting@@@, and severe @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@epigastric pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Syed SB, Reyes JVM, Baig M. Lisinopril-Induced Acute Necrotizing Pancreatitis Cureus. 2021 Apr 23;13(4):e14642. PMID: 34046276
citations.BibTeX: @article{34046276, title={Lisinopril-Induced Acute Necrotizing Pancreatitis}, author={Syed SB and Reyes JVM and Baig M}, journal={Cureus}, volume={13}, number={4}, pages={e14642}}

results.title: A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.
results.text_hl: Here, we present a case of @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@visceral angioedema@@@ in a 32-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who presented with @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@left upper quadrant pain@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@, and characteristic radiographic signs of small @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@bowel angio-edema@@@, six months after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Pinto MB, Vecchio M, Santos MA. A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor. R I Med J (2013). 2022 Aug 1;105(6):28-31. PMID: 35881996
citations.BibTeX: @article{35881996, title={A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.}, author={Pinto MB and Vecchio M and Santos MA}, journal={R I Med J (2013)}, volume={105}, number={6}, pages={28-31}}

results.title: Iatrogenic Hypotension Induced by the Improper Treatment of Normal Grief
results.text_hl: After developing symptoms of @DISEASE_Chest_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@, intermittent @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@, and widespread @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ when he would think of his children in the weeks following their loss, he was prescribed @CHEMICAL_Gabapentin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077206 @@@gabapentin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ by a general practice nurse.

citations.NLM: Robinson KE. Iatrogenic Hypotension Induced by the Improper Treatment of Normal Grief Case Rep Psychiatry. 2021;2021():6661943. PMID: 33936830
citations.BibTeX: @article{33936830, title={Iatrogenic Hypotension Induced by the Improper Treatment of Normal Grief}, author={Robinson KE}, journal={Case Rep Psychiatry}, volume={2021}, pages={6661943}}

results.title: [Effects of lisinopril on diabetic peripheral neuropathy: experiment with rats].
results.text_hl: The potency of heat @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ leg retraction response of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group was significantly shorter than that pf the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ control group (P < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Han LP, Yu DM, Xie Y. [Effects of lisinopril on diabetic peripheral neuropathy: experiment with rats]. Zhonghua Yi Xue Za Zhi. 2008 Sep 16;88(35):2513-5. PMID: 19080636
citations.BibTeX: @article{19080636, title={[Effects of lisinopril on diabetic peripheral neuropathy: experiment with rats].}, author={Han LP and Yu DM and Xie Y}, journal={Zhonghua Yi Xue Za Zhi}, volume={88}, number={35}, pages={2513-5}}

results.title: [Comparative Assessment of Effects of Free and Fixed Combinations of Hypotensive Drugs on Quality of Life of Patients With Arterial Hypertension of High and Very High Risk].
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Use of fixed @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ combination in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@AH@@@ with high and very high risk of @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular complications@@@ compared with free combinations of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@ was associated with statistically significant improvement of a number of QL parameters as assessed by SF-36 questionnaire: physical functioning, bodily @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@, general health, social functioning, and mental health.

citations.NLM: Gridina SA, Povetkin SV. [Comparative Assessment of Effects of Free and Fixed Combinations of Hypotensive Drugs on Quality of Life of Patients With Arterial Hypertension of High and Very High Risk]. Kardiologiia. 2016 Mar;56(3):25-29. PMID: 28294885
citations.BibTeX: @article{28294885, title={[Comparative Assessment of Effects of Free and Fixed Combinations of Hypotensive Drugs on Quality of Life of Patients With Arterial Hypertension of High and Very High Risk].}, author={Gridina SA and Povetkin SV}, journal={Kardiologiia}, volume={56}, number={3}, pages={25-29}}

results.title: [Merits of paracetamol in osteoarthritic hypertensive patients].
results.text_hl: Blood pressure was measured with standard mercury sphygmomanometer and with an automatic device, in standing, sitting and supine position. The intensity of @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@arthritic pain@@@ (on a visual analogue scale from 1 to 10, where 0 means "no @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@" and 10 "the worst @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ you may imagine") and the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@'s quality of life estimate (on a visual analogue scale from 1 to 10, where 0 means "general condition excellent" and 10 "the worst possible") were recorded.

citations.NLM: Pavlicević I, Kuzmanić M, Rumboldt M, Rumboldt Z. [Merits of paracetamol in osteoarthritic hypertensive patients]. Acta Med Croatica. 2011 Mar;65(1):55-62. PMID: 21568075
citations.BibTeX: @article{21568075, title={[Merits of paracetamol in osteoarthritic hypertensive patients].}, author={Pavlicević I and Kuzmanić M and Rumboldt M and Rumboldt Z}, journal={Acta Med Croatica}, volume={65}, number={1}, pages={55-62}}

results.title: Pain relief and clinical improvement temporally related to the use of pentoxifylline in a patient with documented cholesterol emboli--a case report.
results.text_hl: Within twenty-four hours @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ was markedly decreased.

citations.NLM: Carr ME Jr, Sanders K, Todd WM. Pain relief and clinical improvement temporally related to the use of pentoxifylline in a patient with documented cholesterol emboli--a case report. Angiology. 1994 Jan;45(1):65-9. PMID: 8285387
citations.BibTeX: @article{8285387, title={Pain relief and clinical improvement temporally related to the use of pentoxifylline in a patient with documented cholesterol emboli--a case report.}, author={Carr ME Jr and Sanders K and Todd WM}, journal={Angiology}, volume={45}, number={1}, pages={65-9}}

results.title: Pregabalin and simvastatin: first report of a case of rhabdomyolysis.
results.text_hl: He was taking multiple @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ and @DISEASE_Drug_Resistant_Epilepsy @DISEASE_MESH:D000069279 @@@neuropathic medications@@@ and had recently started taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (e.g., @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Zestril@@@) and @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Kaufman MB, Choy M. Pregabalin and simvastatin: first report of a case of rhabdomyolysis. P T. 2012 Oct;37(10):579-95. PMID: 23115467
citations.BibTeX: @article{23115467, title={Pregabalin and simvastatin: first report of a case of rhabdomyolysis.}, author={Kaufman MB and Choy M}, journal={P T}, volume={37}, number={10}, pages={579-95}}
